alert.note: Alert for Baker County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 1:37PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Baker County through 230 PM PDT... At 137 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over McEwen, or 12 miles west of Baker City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mason Dam around 140 PM PDT. Elkhorn Peak around 150 PM PDT. Baker City around 220 PM PDT. Haines and Flagstaff Hill around 230 PM PDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
